title: Instructional Design Techniques and Achievement Motivation Development: Collaborative Learning and Electronic Interaction-Centered Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Educational Theory and Project-Based Learning Experience
context.additional_context: In smartphone-centric, limited-technology environments, enhancing asynchronous interaction is the core focus.

learning_goals: Learners can create specific instructional design documents using teaching anchor-based collaborative learning strategies.
Learners can exchange feedback with peers within 24 hours using asynchronous electronic interaction tools and achieve over 80% project completion.
Learners can achieve scores improved by over 20% compared to pre-tests in the Achievement Motivation Scale (AMS) assessment.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
